historical:
Legislative History of Laws

For D.C. Law 13-297, see notes following ยง 3-1251.01.

DC CODE ยง 3-1251.12

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: A nurse participating in the Program who moves to a jurisdiction where a rehabilitation program is in place and applies for licensure in that jurisdiction shall be transferred to that jurisdiction's rehabilitation program.

A nurse participating in the Program who moves to a jurisdiction where there is no rehabilitation program and applies for licensure in that jurisdiction shall have his or her records transferred to that jurisdiction's equivalent of the Board.
Whenever a nurse who applies for licensure in another jurisdiction continues to practice nursing in the District of Columbia:
If the jurisdiction has a rehabilitation program in place, the program shall be notified that the nurse is participating in a rehabilitation program in the District of Columbia; or

If there is no rehabilitation program in the jurisdiction, the jurisdiction's equivalent of the Board shall be notified that the nurse is participating in a rehabilitation program in the District of Columbia.

title.text: District of Columbia Boards and Commissions. (Refs & Annos)

heading.catch_text: Nurses leaving the District of Columbia or applying for licensure in another state.
